intro: Callitriche verna f. fontana, commonly known as the spring water starwort, is a aquatic or semi-aquatic flowering plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds, ditches, and wet meadows. The plant features small, star-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring, usually from April to June. Its leaves are whorled and floating, with a slender, branching stem. The species is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to form dense mats on water surfaces.
